definition: to hear of/to hear about
ear/handle (archaeology)/and that is all (Classical Chinese)
surname Wen
to hear/news/well-known/famous/reputation/fame/to smell/to sniff at
to witness personally
seeing sth for oneself is better than hearing about it from others
pinyin: er3 wen2 bu4 ru2 mu4 jian4

sentences.english: Everyone had either seen or heard of these huge creatures and knew where the problem lay.
sentences.chinese: 像這種大型生物，大家耳聞目睹，還知道問題所在。

sentences.english: TIGELLINUS: Sire I heard nothing concerning the matter.
I have long heard about Quanzhou.
sentences.chinese: 說起泉州我可是早有耳聞。

sentences.english: This article is to introduce the stylistic features and functions of the Hard-Sell advertisement.
sentences.chinese: “硬賣”廣告是人們每天眼見耳聞的一種廣告。

sentences.english: During that time I witnessed or heard about a lot of things.
sentences.chinese: 其間耳聞目睹的事，算起來也很不少。

sentences.english: We've heard it before: most Americans have a pretty big problem with food.
sentences.chinese: 我們一直對大多數美國人關於食物的問題有所耳聞。

sentences.english: They also explain why many educated Chinese have heard of punting.
sentences.chinese: 這也解釋了爲什麼中國遊客對劍橋的划船總有耳聞。

sentences.english: In the future, you can expect to hear and see much more of this young talent.
sentences.chinese: 未來，你會更多地期望耳聞目睹這位年輕的新秀。

sentences.english: I've heard that your company's medical plan is one of the best in the business.
sentences.chinese: 我早有耳聞你們公司的醫療保險在業界是最棒的。

sentences.english: THE early capital of China’s Song dynasty, Kaifeng (how many westerners have even heard of it?), was in the 11th century the greatest city on earth.
sentences.chinese: 開封，多少西方人對這座城市有所耳聞？

sentences.english: In the past few years, I have read much about your corporation and its excellent management.
sentences.chinese: 過去的幾年中，我對貴公司和其傑出的管理有所耳聞。

sentences.english: You have probably heard all of this before.
sentences.chinese: 也許您對此早就有所耳聞。

sentences.english: You hear about it in various terms that sound abstract.
sentences.chinese: 你們會對風險管理的抽象語彙有所耳聞。

sentences.english: First, people have already heard the arguments against the practice.
sentences.chinese: 首先，人們對反對這種做法的理由已有耳聞。

definition: to suffer untold hardships (idiom); trials and tribulations/with difficulty/after some effort
to be eager to give sth a try (idiom)
déjà vu (the experience of seeing exactly the same situation a second time)/seemingly familiar/apparently already acquainted
in front of the door
top of streets, bottom of alleys (idiom); everywhere in the city
too numerous to mention individually or one by one
to hear (sth said)/one hears (that)/hearsay/listening and speaking
local conditions and customs (idiom)
different routes to the same destination (idiom); fig. different means of achieve the same end
to glare like a tiger watching his prey (idiom)/to eye covetously
to savor/to relish
although/even though
family history (as a literary genre)
handed down in a family/family traditions
unheard of/an extremely rare and unprecedented event
to reveal outstanding talent (idiom); to stand out as conspicuously brilliant
opposite bank (of a body of water)
